decks.notes: The main concept of this Izzet Control deck is to utilize a combination of spells, creatures, and lands to control the game by countering opponent's spells, drawing cards, and dealing damage. The deck focuses on generating card advantage and tempo by using spells like Divide by Zero and Combustion Technique, while also incorporating creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Gran-Gran for additional threats. The lands in the deck provide the necessary mana fixing and flexibility to cast spells efficiently, allowing the player to maintain control of the game and outmaneuver their opponent.

This UW Control deck focuses on using counterspells and removal to control the game, while also utilizing cards like Consult the Star Charts and The Wandering Emperor to generate card advantage and stay ahead. The addition of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds an extra creature to the deck for additional pressure. The deck also benefits from powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer to help stabilize and take over the game. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and out-value the opponent to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and versatile creatures like Ouroboroid and Sentinel of the Nameless City. The deck also includes cards like Culling Ritual and Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber to maintain advantage and disrupt opponents' strategies. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes cards like Mutavault and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and dominate the game through careful resource management and strategic play.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse, along with hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Duress. It also aims to generate card advantage with Preacher of the Schism and Blade of the Oni, while also gaining life and putting pressure on the opponent with Gifted Aetherborn. The deck tries to maintain a strong board presence with creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, while also utilizing lands like Bleachbone Verge for extra value. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of control and recursion.

The deck focuses on quickly discarding Arclight Phoenixes to the graveyard and then bringing them back to the battlefield for massive damage. It utilizes cheap spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to enable the Phoenix's ability. The deck also includes cards like Consider and Opt to help filter through the deck and find the necessary pieces. The key strategy is to be aggressive early on, utilizing efficient spells and creatures to overwhelm the opponent and bring back Arclight Phoenix for repeated damage.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and creatures that can generate value over time. The main strategy is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while slowly building up your own board presence. The deck includes a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Maelstrom Pulse, along with hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The creatures in the deck, such as Badgermole Cub and Ouroboroid, provide additional ways to control the game and apply pressure to your opponent.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless barrage of aggressive creatures and burn spells. By using low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage alongside powerful burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck looks to establish early board presence and quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins provide additional reach and versatility, ensuring that the deck can close out games even in the face of opposing threats.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, efficient creatures and instant spells. By utilizing cards like Emberheart Challenger, Monastery Swiftspear, and Soul-Scar Mage along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to maintain pressure and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The deck also includes cards like Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent to maintain card advantage and provide additional reach. This deck thrives on early aggression and efficient use of resources to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost, efficient creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to apply pressure early on, combined with instant damage spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, this deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. With efficient mana sources like Ramunap Ruins and Den of the Bugbear, the deck can maintain a steady stream of threats while keeping up the pressure on the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage and control the board. By efficiently using cheap creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear along with powerful burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game. Additionally, cards like Experimental Synthesizer and Cori-Steel Cutter provide additional value and versatility to adapt to different situations. The mana base includes lands that can provide both red and blue mana to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing creatures like Archon of Emeria, Badgermole Cub, and Ouroboroid to put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down the opponent's game plan. Collected Company allows for quick creature deployment, while Elspeth, Storm Slayer provides additional threats and removal options. Overall, the deck aims to establish board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and versatile creatures. It aims to control the board and the opponent's resources while gradually building advantage with efficient threats and disruption. By utilizing a mix of creature-based and spell-based control elements, the deck is able to adapt to various strategies and maintain a strong tempo advantage. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Carnage Tyrant and Lilianna of the Veil ensures that the deck can close out games once it has gained control.

This deck focuses on using aggressive red creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. It includes powerful aggro cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, along with efficient burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage. The goal is to apply early pressure and maintain it throughout the game, using cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Soul-Scar Mage to control the board while dealing damage. Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins provide additional reach and flexibility in finishing off opponents.

The main idea of this Izzet Control deck is to manipulate the opponent's board through various spells and abilities while maintaining card advantage through drawing cards and countering key spells. By utilizing a mix of removal, card draw, and control elements, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the defensive while setting up for a powerful win condition with cards like Divide by Zero and Stormchaser's Talent. The deck also includes options for direct damage and board control, ensuring flexibility in dealing with a variety of threats.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By playing efficient creatures like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben early on, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while building a board presence. The deck also utilizes cards like Collected Company and Skyclave Apparition to generate value and deal with threats. With a mix of ramp and removal, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and maintain control of the battlefield to secure a quick victory.

The key concept of this Orzhov Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through hand disruption and removal spells while gaining incremental advantage with efficient creatures and planeswalkers. The deck aims to control the game with a combination of removal, protection, and powerful win conditions like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The mana base is designed to support a consistent and smooth curve, allowing the deck to outvalue and outlast opponents in a longer game. Overall, the deck prioritizes attrition and resource management to grind out a victory in a slow and controlled manner.
